reviews.review_msg: horrible...his slides have so many errors and their BIG errors too it's not funny. His emails are inaccurate and gives you the wrong answer also BEWARE

I read the comments but still took the class because I had hope I could pass, boy was I wrong. The midterm average was a fail and the TA's gave horrible feedback. His lectures explain nothing and his assignments are impossible to do since nothing is properly taught. I CANNOT stress this enough, take this course with another prof!

Do not take a class with Schwartz if you don't absolutely have to. I needed a C- in this class and he gave me a D. All lectures are recorded and are around 6-8 minutes long PER WEEK. Otherwise, you are essentially teaching yourself the course via the textbook. What is the point having a prof if they make you teach yourself the course??

Please don't take this class. Everything is self-taught and it's so complicated. His weekly "lectures" are about 5 minutes long and all he talks about is his soccer jersey. You have to teach yourself through the whole course and it's super hard to get help. If you have to take STAT 203, don't take it with Tim. Take it in person with another prof.

This prof is the worst one I have ever had. He's too lazy to teach for more than 5 minutes in his lecture videos and does not give out his email to contact him. This guy needs to be fired asap because the future of education is going to fail because of this guy.

Do not take a course with this prof. Lectures are just 8-10 min videos that summarize the chapter, leaving you to read the textbook and pretty much learn everything by yourself. Marks exams in a way designed to make you do bad, especially the final. Your GPA will take a huge hit. Avoid at all costs.
Amazing prof. So helpful, always available for extra help. He will really try and make sure you understand the material. Does not move too fast at all.
HORRIBLE prof. moves through material WAY too fast.

Jack is extremely helpful if you go to his office hours. Notes were posted online before lecture. The course itself is difficult so people shouldn't blame the prof for making it hard. Jack tries his best to make it interesting. Definitely recommend taking this course with Jack!!

Derek's lectures were clear and had lots of examples. It's important to attend the lectures to get the answers for the examples so you can study them. The midterm and final questions all come from the weekly assignments, suggested textbook problems and examples in class making the tests very fair.

I LOVE DEREK! He is so adorable and hilarious, he made statistics a bearable course. I was dreading taking stats (it was inevitable for me), but I am so fortunate to have Derek as my professor. He is always willing to help students, gives rather entertaining lectures (that's how good he is, he made statss my favourite course) and knows his stuff.

worst professor I had so far. very boring and disorganized. she doesn't care if we understand the material or not and doesn't answer questions. she tells you to look in the slides or in the book or to " think about it". she gives you 2 quizzes, homework and an assignment a week before the midterm and asks why you don't understand the new material?

She's nice but nice does nothing for you when you're so confused. She never gave a straight answer and often said "i'll turn this back to you guys to discuss". Lectures are a waste of time and you spent the whole time doing group work. She moves quickly and expects you to just read & understand everything on your own. Wouldn't recommend at all!
Her class is just so awful. Please avoid. I am going to have to retake this course to actually learn what was supposed to be taught to us.

AVOID taking a class with her! she doesnt use the same formulas as in the text so when it comes to assignments and exams it ruins your grade because the ta's mark in accordance to the text.. also the exams were extremely hard and nothing like the assignments AT ALL!
I really like her, she's super funny. However, it was hard to understand what she was talking about most of the time. In order to do well in the class you would have to go for extra help elsewhere.

She is a new teacher and a PhD student so she is relatively new and inexperienced. Easily confused in class but very friendly and helpful in office hours. Easy prof and tries her best to make sure you know your stuff. You get a cheatsheet for the midterm.

He literally tells you what is on the exam and emphasizes everything you need to know. Really nice guy and a good prof. Sucks that he's leaving to go back to Singapore because he was definitely an assets to the STATS department at SFU!
This professor clearly supports those with a science background in his lectures.  The time constraints are unfair and the length of assignments are unrealistic.

Unhelpful;exams were difficult to complete due to time constraints.Would not recommend this course to the 'mathematically challenged' due to the fact that the concepts are difficult because his lecture notes differ from the textbook(which he tells you to read). Lectures are quite dull and Insley doesn't explain the course basics in a helpful manner

Not recommended! Prof Insley is unwilling to help, lectures are confusing it's better to just study on your own via text book. Exams are unfair due to time constraints, he makes them too long for the time allotted! his teaching style is ineffective, not compelling and extremely boring. I did well in the class but no thanks to him!

Assignments do not prepare students for the exams. Exam questions were tricky; he could have made them easier. He stated that people in the "social sciences are not used to their low averages" in his course, which makes me think that he purposely made his course this difficult. It could be simpler.
